meta.title: Getting Started - Semantic Self-Aware Kit
meta.description: Installation, setup, and first steps with the Semantic Self-Aware Kit

content_blocks.content:
🚀 Getting Started

Installation, setup, and first steps with the Semantic Self-Aware Kit

Quick Start Overview

The Semantic Self-Aware Kit is a Python framework for building AI systems with semantic reasoning, uncertainty quantification, and collaborative capabilities. This guide will get you up and running in just a few steps.

Prerequisites

  • • Python 3.8 or higher
  • • pip package manager
  • • Basic understanding of Python
  • • Optional: Docker for containerized components

📦 Installation Guide

Installation from Source

For development or to get the latest features, install from source:

# 1. Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Nubaeon/semantic-self-aware-kit.git
cd semantic-self-aware-kit
# 2. Create and activate a virtual environment
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
# 3. Install in development mode
pip install -e .

Standard Installation

Install the latest stable release from PyPI:

# Install the semantic self-aware kit
pip install semantic-self-aware-kit
# Verify installation
python -c "import semantic_self_aware_kit; print('Installed successfully!')"

📋 Core Dependencies

The framework will automatically install all required packages from `requirements.txt`.

How to Use the Components

The Semantic Self-Aware Kit provides a suite of powerful components for building intelligent AI systems. Here’s how you can start using them.

Structured Decision-Making with `metacognitive_cascade`

For any complex decision, use the `metacognitive_cascade` to ensure a structured and uncertainty-aware process. This is ideal for situations where the AI needs to be transparent about its reasoning.

from semantic_self_aware_kit.metacognitive_cascade import cascade
decision = "Should I refactor this complex module?"
result = cascade.run_full_cascade(decision)
print(f"Confidence: {result.confidence_level}, Actions: {result.required_actions}")

Understanding Code with `code_intelligence_analyzer`

To gain a deep understanding of a codebase, use the `code_intelligence_analyzer`. It combines code archaeology, semantic analysis, and architectural insights.

from semantic_self_aware_kit.code_intelligence_analyzer import CodeIntelligenceAnalyzer
analyzer = CodeIntelligenceAnalyzer("./my_project")
analysis = analyzer.comprehensive_analysis()
print(analysis['synthesis']['key_recommendations'])

Measuring Performance with `empirical_performance_analyzer`

To objectively measure the performance of your AI, use the `empirical_performance_analyzer`. It provides metrics on speed, reliability, and quality.

from semantic_self_aware_kit.empirical_performance_analyzer import EmpiricalPerformanceAnalyzer
analyzer = EmpiricalPerformanceAnalyzer()
benchmark_results = analyzer.comprehensive_benchmark("my_ai_agent")
print(benchmark_results['executive_summary'])

🎉 Next Steps

You are now ready to start building with the Semantic Self-Aware Kit. Here’s what to explore next:

Explore Components

Dive deeper into the capabilities of each component.

View Examples

See more practical examples and tutorials.
